description: Unique identifier of the asset the alert pertains to; links to the asset master/vehicle record.
Standardized category of the asset for this alert; used for routing, reporting, and triage.
Sequence number of the alert within an asset, likely not globally unique; used to distinguish multiple alerts for the same asset (confirm with SME).
Free-text description of the alert, detailing the issue, required parts, or actions to take; visible to maintenance and operations.
Priority level assigned to the alert to indicate urgency and impact for scheduling and escalation.
User ID of the person who created the alert.
Timestamp when the alert was created.
User ID of the person who last updated the alert.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the alert.
User ID of the person who marked the alert as resolved/closed.
Timestamp when the alert was marked resolved/closed.
User ID of the person who deleted or archived the alert (likely soft delete; confirm with SME).
Timestamp when the alert was deleted or archived, likely indicating a soft delete; confirm with SME.
Additional internal comments related to the alert (status updates, research, parts ordering details).
